methods.name: EqualEqual_InputDeviceId
methods.doc: Returns true if InputDeviceId A is equal to InputDeviceId B (A == B)

methods.name: EqualEqual_PlatformUserId
methods.doc: Returns true if PlatformUserId A is equal to PlatformUserId B (A == B)

methods.name: GetAllActiveUsers
GetAllConnectedInputDevices
GetAllInputDevices
GetAllInputDevicesForUser
GetDefaultInputDevice
methods.doc: Returns the default device id used for things like keyboard/mouse input

methods.name: GetInputDeviceConnectionState
GetPlayerControllerFromInputDevice
methods.doc: Get the player controller who owns the given input device id

methods.name: GetPlayerControllerFromPlatformUser
methods.doc: Get the player controller who has the given Platform User ID.

methods.name: GetPrimaryInputDeviceForUser
methods.doc: Returns the primary input device used by a specific player, or INPUTDEVICEID_NONE if invalid

methods.name: GetPrimaryPlatformUser
methods.doc:
Returns the 'Primary' Platform user for this platform.
This typically has an internal ID of '0' and is used as the default platform user to
map devices such as the keyboard and mouse that don't get assigned unique ID's from their
owning platform code.

methods.name: GetUserForInputDevice
methods.doc: Returns the platform user attached to this input device, or PLATFORMUSERID_NONE if invalid

methods.name: GetUserForUnpairedInputDevices
methods.doc:
Returns the platform user id that is being used for unmapped input devices.
Will be PLATFORMUSERID_NONE if platform does not support this (this is the default behavior)

methods.name: InputDeviceId_None
methods.doc: Static invalid input device

methods.name: IsDevicePropertyHandleValid
methods.doc: Returns true if the given handle is valid

methods.name: IsInputDeviceMappedToUnpairedUser
methods.doc: Returns true if the given input device is mapped to the unpaired platform user id.

methods.name: IsUnpairedUserId
methods.doc: Returns true if the given Platform User Id is the user for unpaired input devices on this platform.

methods.name: IsValidInputDevice
methods.doc:
Check if the given input device is valid

@return      True if the given input device is valid (it has been assigned an ID by the PlatformInputDeviceMapper)

methods.name: IsValidPlatformId
methods.doc:
Check if the given platform ID is valid

@return      True if the platform ID is valid (it has been assigned by the PlatformInputDeviceMapper)

methods.name: NotEqual_InputDeviceId
methods.doc: Returns true if InputDeviceId A is not equal to InputDeviceId B (A != B)

methods.name: NotEqual_PlatformUserId
methods.doc: Returns true if PlatformUserId A is not equal to PlatformUserId B (A != B)

methods.name: PlatformUserId_None
methods.doc: Static invalid platform user
